title.narrative: JEUNES; AGISSEZ AU COTE DES POLITICIENS POUR L’AVENIR

description.narrative: Les bénéficiaires directs du programme: Les jeunes leaders des sections jeunesses des partis politiques, Les jeunes leaders des confessions religieuses Les jeunes leaders des organisations de la société civile Les représentants des centres jeunes Les leaders des jeunes des différentes universités Les leaders des partis politiques Certaines institutions étatiques (le ministère de la jeunesse, la CENI, Ministère de l'intérieur)

Project outputs: - 60 senior leaders in network - 250 youth in network - 3 surveys and reports produced - 90 radio commercials aired - 4 newspaper articles written - 4 live debates with politicians and youth leaders broadcasted on both TV and radio - More than 270 people reached by campaigns and public debates - 3 workshops with young leaders, youth and senior leaders political parties on the position of youth in political parties held and broadcasted. - 6 lobbying meetings to advocate for 25 youth leaders in political parties to be placed in mid-level positions in political parties - 100 copies of a document containing proposed policies to be adopted by political parties and government from report published are distributed to political parties and interest groups

The Partner shares the vision of the Programme: the consortium partners are united in the overall objective of the Programme: to reduce instability in three fragile state environments through strengthening the institutional capacity of relevant political and civil society stakeholders to improve the social-economic position of young men and women. The Programme makes the strategic choice to focus on the socio-economic position of young women and men[[1] Young men and women refers to the age group of 18-35 years old1], and aims to create an enabling environment for youth entrepreneurship and youth participation in the public sector and in civil society. The Youth Engagement Programme and its partners work towards this objective efficiently and effectively;
(1) Capacity building of your organisation, and of political parties, movements and/or relevant interest groups to advocate for the improvement of the socio-economic position of youth Build capacity of staff members in strategic planning, project management and human resource management (2) Increase of youth participation in political parties, movements and/or relevant interest groups through leadership training and coaching for youth Conduct a study to analyse the current state of affairs with regards to the concerns of young people which are addressed in the political party programs for 2015 then thereafter educate the youth on the content of these programs. (3) Strengthening multi-party and multi stakeholders dialogue on the improvement of the socio-economic position of youth, involving political parties, movements and/or relevant interest groups Advocate for the consideration of the main concerns of young people during the development of the 2015 political party programs and influence policy for youth leaders to be placed on blocked lists.
